Himachal Pradesh landslide: Massive section of hill collapses near Chaukar village — watch
description: A massive landslide near Chaukar village in Sirmaur's Nauhradhar area caused a 200-meter section of hill to collapse, threatening nearby homes. While five people present at the site are safe, five houses now fall within the danger zone due to heavy monsoon rains causing soil erosion. Authorities are monitoring the area and urging vigilance.

title: Ken Dryden dies at 78: Hall of fame goalie battled with cancer
description: Ken Dryden, the Montreal Canadiens' legendary goalie, has died at 78 after battling cancer. A Hockey Hall of Famer, he led the Canadiens to six Stanley Cups in the 1970s. Dryden's career included success at Cornell, a pivotal role in the 1972 Summit Series, and later, achievements as a broadcaster, politician, and author, leaving an enduring legacy on the sport.

The plan, requiring up to a 10-year commitment, hinges on Tesla achieving unprecedented targets in market capitalization, vehicle deliveries, and robotics deployment. Shareholder approval is needed for this historic compensation package.

description: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has arrested Sharanjit Kumar, a key suspect in the Thakurdwara temple grenade attack in Amritsar, from Gaya, Bihar. He is accused of being actively involved in the conspiracy and execution of the terror attack.

‘Politically motivated violence’: Khalistani groups receive funds from Canada; report raises red flags
description: A Canadian Department of Finance report reveals that Khalistani extremist groups, along with Hamas and Hezbollah, receive financial support from Canada. These groups exploit charities and non-profit organizations to fund politically motivated violence. Canadian intelligence confirms that Khalistani extremists use Canada as a base for fundraising and planning violence in India, raising concerns about the impact on relations with India.

title: Raja Raghuvanshi murder case: SIT files 790-page chargesheet; Sonam, lover Raj among 5 accused
description: Meghalaya Police's SIT has filed a chargesheet in the Raja Raghuvanshi honeymoon murder case, implicating his wife, Sonam Raghuvanshi, her lover, Raj Singh Kushwaha, and three accomplices. The Indore-based businessman was murdered at a gorge in Sohra, with Sonam present during the crime.

The victim arrived at the police station with a knife in his chest and was promptly hospitalized. The attack was motivated by revenge, as one of the accused believed the victim instigated a prior assault on him.

description: Uzbekistan's Nodirbek Abdusattorov has stirred the chess world by predicting that India's youngest world champion, D Gukesh, will lose his title in the next defense. Viswanathan Anand responded with amusement, acknowledging the comment's entertainment value. Gukesh, unfazed, focused on the Candidates Tournament qualification race, where Abdusattorov is a contender alongside other strong players.

title: ‘GST mein kuch kaam kariye’: FM recalls PM Modi’s words; focus was on ensuring ease of compliance
description: GST rates have been rationalized on numerous items, significantly reducing the number of slabs and altering procedures. The Finance Minister emphasized a user-centric approach, considering daily use, aspirations, and the needs of farmers and MSMEs. These changes aim to ease compliance, boost consumption, and foster economic growth, while addressing concerns from states and exporters.

Known for his unconventional views, the actor did not shy away from admitting that parenthood isn’t part of his life plan.

title: Health emergency: 'Mysterious illness' kills 20 in Andhra village; spread via water
description: Andhra Pradesh government addresses a health crisis in Turakapalem. Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu orders a health emergency after numerous deaths. Health camps are planned, and experts will investigate the cause. Protected drinking water will be supplied. A committee is formed to investigate reporting failures. Health Minister Y Satya Kumar Yadav assures action against negligent officials.

title: ‘Threatening’ IPS officer row: Ajit Pawar says he respects women cops; FIR filed against 4
description: Following accusations of threatening an IPS officer, a case was filed against four individuals in Solapur for obstructing officials during an anti-illegal sand mining operation. Ajit Pawar clarified his intent was to maintain peace, not interfere with law enforcement. Opposition parties demand Pawar be named in the FIR, alleging obstruction of duty, while his nephew defends his communication style.

title: West Bengal man thrashed in Odisha: Mob brands him Bangladeshi; breaks hand for ‘speaking Bengali’
description: Tarzan Sheikh, a migrant worker from Katwa, alleged he was assaulted in Odisha for being a "Bengali-speaking Bangladeshi." Sheikh, who has been working as a hawker in Jaleshwar for five years, was reportedly attacked near Lakshmandihi area after speaking in Bengali. The mob allegedly stole Rs 6,000 and fractured his arm, branding his documents as forged.

title: Uttarakhand: Students take Rs 10k chopper ride to exam hall; cover 280km in 30 mins
description: Due to landslides blocking road access to Munsyari in Pithoragarh, four BEd students from Rajasthan chartered a helicopter from Haldwani to ensure they could take their examination.

title: Nepal social media ban: Facebook, Twitter among 26 apps blocked; Govt explains why
description: Nepal has banned major social media platforms like Facebook, YouTube, and X after they failed to register with the government by the given deadline. This decision follows a Supreme Court directive to regulate online platforms and monitor content.

title: Meta’s brain drain: Why AI engineers quit; startup CEO cites Zuckerberg’s own words
description: Memories.ai CEO Shawn Shen reveals that Meta's frequent reorganizations are driving AI researchers to seek opportunities elsewhere, including his own startup. Memories.ai is offering lucrative compensation packages, up to $2 million, to attract top talent. The company has already hired a former Meta research scientist as its chief AI officer and plans to expand its AI team significantly.

title: Manny Pacquiao net worth in 2025: Breaking down his boxing, endorsements, politics income
description: Manny Pacquiao, by 2025, amassed a $220 million fortune through boxing, endorsements, and strategic business ventures. His boxing career, highlighted by a $575 million earning and a lucrative Mayweather fight, significantly fueled his wealth. Endorsements with major brands like Nike and ventures such as Manny Pacquiao Promotions further amplified his financial success.
